Issues.Title: fix(ivy): speed up ngtsc if project has no templates to check
Issues.Body:
If a project being built with ngtsc has no templates to check, then ngtsc
previously generated an empty typecheck file. This seems to trigger some
pathological behavior in TS where the entire user program is re-checked,
which is extremely expensive. This likely has to do with the fact that the
empty file is not considered an ES module, meaning the module structure of
the program has changed.

This commit causes an export to be produced in the typecheck file regardless
of its other contents, which guarantees that it will be an ES module. The
pathological behavior is avoided and template type-checking is fast once
again.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ivy): speed up ngtsc if project has no templates to check" (#31922)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): correctly associate output bound events with directives
Issues.Body:
Previously, bound events were incorrectly bound to directives with
inputs matching the bound event attribute. This fixes that so bound
events can only be bound to directives with matching outputs.

Adds tests for all kinds of directive matching on bound attributes.

Issues.Title: feat(language-service): Introduce 'angularOnly' flag
Issues.Body:
This PR changes the language service to work in two different modes:

1. TS + Angular
   Plugin augments TS language service to provide additonal Angular
   information. This only works with inline template and is meant to be
   used as a local plugin (configured via tsconfig.json).
2. Angular only
   Plugin only provides information on Angular templates, no TS info at
   all. This effectively disables native TS features and is meant for
   internal use only.

Default mode is `angularOnly = false` so that we don't break any users
already using Angular LS as local plugin.

As part of the refactoring, `undefined` is removed from type aliases
because it is considered bad practice.

go/tsstyle#nullableundefined-type-aliases
```
Type aliases must not include |null or |undefined in a union type.
Nullable aliases typically indicate that null values are being passed
around through too many layers of an application, and this clouds the
source of the original issue that resulted in null. They also make it
unclear when specific values on a class or interface might be absent.
```

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): ngcc emits static fields before extra statements
Issues.Body:
This commit changes the emit order of ngcc when a class has multiple static
fields being assigned. Previously, ngcc would emit each static field
followed immediately by any extra statements specified for that field. This
causes issues with downstream tooling such as build optimizer, which expects
all of the static fields for a class to be grouped together. ngtsc already
groups static fields and additional statements. This commit changes ngcc's
ordering to match.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): ngcc emits static fields before extra statements" (#31933)

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): reuse compilation scope for incremental template changes.
Issues.Body:
Previously if only a component template changed then we would know to
rebuild its component source file. But the compilation was incorrect if the
component was part of an NgModule, since we were not capturing the
compilation scope information that had a been acquired from the NgModule
and was not being regenerated since we were not needing to recompile
the NgModule.

Now we register compilation scope information for each component, via the
`ComponentScopeRegistry` interface, so that it is available for incremental
compilation.

The `ComponentDecoratorHandler` now reads the compilation scope from a
`ComponentScopeReader` interface which is implemented as a compound
reader composed of the original `LocalModuleScopeRegistry` and the
`IncrementalState`.

Fixes #31654
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): reuse compilation scope for incremental template changes." (#31932)

Issues.Title: Reactive Form is disabled but disabled property is false
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/forms ### Description I have simple reactive form with some input fields. The method `form.disable()` is called to disable the form and all fields. The method works, as all input fields in the UI are now disabled. **Expected** The property `form.disabled` should be `true` as the form is disabled now. **Actual** The property `form.disabled` is `false`. **Cause of the problem** After building the form, I subscribe to control `f1` and update the value of another control whenever `f1` changes. ``` this.myForm.controls.f1 .valueChanges .subscribe(() => this.testMethod()); testMethod() { this.myForm.controls.f3.setValue('test'); } ``` **Workaround** It works when I call `form.disable()` twice. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-issue-repro2-g8725l ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: ContentChild - Direct Descendants Only
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
@angular/core

### Description
Similar but opposite to how the `ContentChildren` decorator has descendants option to query all descendants, I would like `ContentChild` to have an option to query only direct descendants.

### Describe the solution you'd like
1. Add `descendants` as a metadata property for `ContentChild`
2. If `descendants` is true or undefined, query all descendants (preserves current behavior)
3. If `descendants` is false, query only direct descendants
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ContentChild - Direct Descendants Only" (#31921)

Issues.Title: fix(language-service): getSourceFile() should only be called on TS files
Issues.Body:
This is in preparation for Angular LS plugin handling external templates (HTML) files.
`getSourceFile()` parses the file and returns `SourceFileObject`, so it must never be called on HTML.
Otherwise, TS errors would show up in diagnostics.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): pass `schemas` field to nested views
Issues.Body:
Prior to this commit, the `schemas` configuration was applied to top-level view only. That leads to problems when using unknown props with elements inside nested views (for example generated as a result of *ngIf). This commit passes `schemas` information down to nested views to make sure that all the checks are consistent.

This PR resolves FW-1492.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ivy): pass `schemas` field to nested views" (#31913)

Issues.Title: Ivy Compilation Failed: ERROR in ENOENT: no such file or directory. ngx-segment-analytics
Issues.Body:
# Bug Report

#### What is the expected behavior?
Should compile correctly with Ivy

#### What is the current behavior?
Only if Ivy is disabled compiles correctly

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
* Install ngx-segment-analytics dependency
* Import the module and compile with Ivy.
* It should fetch the index.js not ngx-segment-analytics.js
* ERROR in ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/node_modules/ngx-segment-analytics/ngx-segment-analytics.js'.

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
This issue happens because the definition file (named ngx-segment-analytics.d.ts which makes `export * from './index.js') does not have the same name of the index.js file. If I rename index.js to be ngx-segment-analytics.js it works.
Behavior should be consistent with Ivy disabled

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular version: 8.1.2
Material: 8.1.2
TypeScript: 3.4.3
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ivy Compilation Failed: ERROR in ENOENT: no such file or directory. ngx-segment-analytics" (#31912)

Issues.Title: Updating w/ `ng update` in project previously updated with `--next` version produces version mismatch
Issues.Body:
üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [x] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Not sure if it ever worked at all ### Description nb: what I call a beta project is a project running the beta versions of angular, which was created or updated with the `--next` argument. Updating a beta project with `ng update` should show at least a warning as it produces versions mismatch. Using `ng update` does not seem to update internal packages (devkit) to latest version of the beta branch. It produces version mismatch which can result in really weird bugs which are tough to find since you need to output the versions using `ng version` to identify the root cause. You can see the problem here: Angular was updated from `0.802.0-next.0` to `8.2.0-next.2` but most of the internal packages were not updated and are still running the `0.802.0-next.0` version. Check this for more people running into the issue without noticing. https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/31654 ``` Angular CLI: 8.2.0-next.0 Node: 10.15.3 OS: linux x64 Angular: 8.2.0-next.2 ... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic ... router Package Version ----------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.802.0-next.0 @angular-devkit/build-angular 0.802.0-next.0 @angular-devkit/build-optimizer 0.802.0-next.0 @angular-devkit/build-webpack 0.802.0-next.0 @angular-devkit/core 8.2.0-next.0 @angular-devkit/schematics 8.2.0-next.0 @angular/cdk 8.1.1 @angular/cli 8.2.0-next.0 @angular/material 8.1.1 @ngtools/webpack 8.2.0-next.0 @schematics/angular 8.2.0-next.0 @schematics/update 0.802.0-next.0 rxjs 6.5.2 typescript 3.4.5 webpack 4.35.3 ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - `ng update --next` - wait for next beta release - `ng update ` (without --next) Results in mismatched versions. ## üî• Exception or Error None ## üåç Your Environment
**Anything else relevant?** Updating a beta project with `ng update` should update similarly to the `ng update --next` or Updating a beta project with `ng update` should show a warning and not do anything at all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Updating w/ `ng update` in project previously updated with `--next` version produces version mismatch" (#15216)

Issues.Title: 8.1.3 output fails to load after upgrading from 8.0.0
Issues.Body:
This is a continuation of #14909 -- I won't paste all the output from the other - it's the same. ### Is this a regression? yes, worked fine in 8.0.0 ### Description Upgraded application from 8.0.0 to 8.1.3 -- and build output fails to load. The source of the issue is loading of a 3rd party library that is not a `strict` script. I've repo'd this by: -creating a new cli project -adding one external library to package.json -import the package in app.module.ts. ```typescript import '@somelib/toolkit.core'; ``` @somelib/toolkit.core is a node module that includes: index.d.ts index.js index.js.map the index.js tries to reassign max_integer and it causes this... 

index.js.pre-build-optimizer.js:1 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot assign to read only property 'MAX_SAFE_INTEGER' of function 'function Number() { [native code] }'
    at index.js.pre-build-optimizer.js:1
## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction the library is in a private repo... I can upload the project with node_modules to github for someone to look at if it helps.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "8.1.3 output fails to load after upgrading from 8.0.0" (#15215)

Issues.Title: fix(angularCompilerPlugin): respect noEmitOnError compiler's option when checking for typescript errors
Issues.Body:
Currently noEmitOnError compiler's option is not respected when executing typescript program. In case when noEmitOnError is false and there are compilation errors in project, no .js files are emitted. However, in this case .js files should be emitted.
In case when noEmitOnError is true and there are compilation errors in project, `.js` files should not be emitted.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(angularCompilerPlugin): respect noEmitOnError compiler's option when checking for typescript errors" (#15199)

Issues.Title: build-optimizer doesn't make Ivy's ngInjectorDef static property assignment available for DCE
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: .... no ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem... While debugging Ivy payload size issues, I noticed that `DeprecatedI18NPipesModule` was not being removed from hello world cli app, but only in the Ivy mode. Digging deeper I noticed that the build pipeline doesn't make `ngInjectorDef` assignments avalable for DCE. Snippet from the pre-terser code: ``` common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule.ngInjectorDef = /*@__PURE__*/ …µ…µdefineInjector({ factory: function DeprecatedI18NPipesModule_Factory(t) { return new (t || common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule)(); }, providers: [{ provide: DEPRECATED_PLURAL_FN, useValue: common_0$2 }] }); ``` Terser won't remove this because it's a static property assignment. So while the right handside is marked as pure, the left handside might have a side effect and therefore will be retained. I think this is a general problem we have in the pipeline where we generally expect that the static properties will be assigned within the PURE IIFE wrapped around a class, but in this case the assignment happens outside of that IIFE likely because of two other function calls (`…µ…µsetNgModuleScope` and `setClassMetadata`) that are emitted in between the class body and the static assignment: ``` let common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule = /*@__PURE__*/ (() => { class DeprecatedI18NPipesModule { } DeprecatedI18NPipesModule.ngModuleDef = …µ…µdefineNgModule({ type: DeprecatedI18NPipesModule }); return DeprecatedI18NPipesModule; })(); /*@__PURE__*/ /*@__PURE__*/ …µ…µsetNgModuleScope(common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule, { declarations: [common_DeprecatedDecimalPipe, common_DeprecatedPercentPipe, common_DeprecatedCurrencyPipe, common_DeprecatedDatePipe], exports: [common_DeprecatedDecimalPipe, common_DeprecatedPercentPipe, common_DeprecatedCurrencyPipe, common_DeprecatedDatePipe] }); /*@__PURE__*/ /*@__PURE__*/ setClassMetadata(common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule, [{ type: NgModule, args: [{ declarations: [COMMON_DEPRECATED_I18N_PIPES], exports: [COMMON_DEPRECATED_I18N_PIPES], providers: [{ provide: DEPRECATED_PLURAL_FN, useValue: common_0$2 }] }] }], null, null); common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule.ngInjectorDef = /*@__PURE__*/ …µ…µdefineInjector({ factory: function DeprecatedI18NPipesModule_Factory(t) { return new (t || common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule)(); }, providers: [{ provide: DEPRECATED_PLURAL_FN, useValue: common_0$2 }] }); ``` Because the static property assignment is now outside of the PURE class IIFE, the static property assignment is ineligible for DCE. To fix this we have two options: 1. ensure that the static property assignment is located within the class body by changing the order in which these things are emitted by ngtsc 2. wrap the static property assignment in a new PURE IIFE: ``` /*@__PURE__*/ (function() { common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule.ngInjectorDef = /*@__PURE__*/ …µ…µdefineInjector({ factory: function DeprecatedI18NPipesModule_Factory(t) { return new (t || common_DeprecatedI18NPipesModule)(); }, providers: [{ provide: DEPRECATED_PLURAL_FN, useValue: common_0$2 }] }); })(); ``` note the IIFE around the assignment marked as pure. I'm slightly leaning towards the options number two just because it's more generic and could catch other issues. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ``` yarn global add @angular/cli@next ng new size-test --enable-ivy cd size-test ng build --prod ``` review bundles and you'll see `DeprecatedI18NPipesModule` retained due to the pattern described above. ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 8.2.0-rc.0
Node: 10.11.0
OS: darwin x64
Angular: 8.2.0-rc.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: Filter Angular proxy routes by HTTP request methods
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [x] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
I am working on a project using Spring boot and angular 6. I have setup multiple proxy routes. Everything is working fine but my requirements changed little. The proxy should forward the request to remote server only the proxy route match and its HTTP request method.
For example: If I call "/login", it should not send request to remote server but local routes of angular should be served. when I call "/login" with POST type then it should send request to remote server.

### Describe the solution you'd like
We should have add a property of method to identify which HTTP method of given path should be forwarded.
```
{
  "/login":{
        "http_method": ["POST", "PUT"],
        "target": "http://localhost:8090",
        "secure": false,
        "logLevel": "debug"
    }
}
```
Therefore, a ( GET: /login ) will not be forwarded to "http://localhost:8090" address.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Filter Angular proxy routes by HTTP request methods" (#15192)

Issues.Title: Should sortingDataAccessor coerce value to number if value type already specified as string?
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-nxkhsk

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on version column header to short ascending or descending to see issue
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Table is sorted by version column string value. It shouldn't matter if the value can be coerced to a number, if the column is defined as a string shouldn't the sort treat it as such?

Table is not sorted correctly by version number.

Issues.Title: overlays not working in CDK 8.1.2
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Here is our related [stackblitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ng-material-812?file=main.ts).  
This uses the same dependencies as our app, but unfortunately we cannot reproduce it on Stackblitz yet. We hope someone can guide us in the right direction to make a reproduction example. 
 
#### Expected Behavior
The overlays should show up in front of all other elements - even in full-screen mode.

#### Actual Behavior
The overlays show up **behind** all other elements, and are invisible. So at first sight it seems that the clicks don't work.

Here is an example what happens in our app:
![ng_mat_cdk_812](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20422904/62217083-4b42ec00-b3aa-11e9-822b-f2f2af58cb68.gif)

* when we first open the app and click on the pager-dropdown the overlay is not shown
* this also happens for other drop-downs (and even for modal dialogs)
* when we switch to full-screen mode (we use [screenfull-js](https://github.com/sindresorhus/screenfull.js/)) the overlays appear
* when we now exit full-screen the drop-downs work correctly

more info: 
* when we revert the @angular/cdk version from `8.1.2` to `8.1.1` the app works correctly
* even with `8.1.2` we can make the app work (at least in non-fullscreen mode) when we deactivate the `FullscreenOverlayContainer`: 
```typescript
@NgModule({
   ...
  // when we deactivate this line, it even works with cdk version 8.1.2
  ,  providers: [{ provide: OverlayContainer, useClass: FullscreenOverlayContainer }]
})
```
* maybe this is related to [pull-request #11940](https://github.com/angular/components/pull/11940)?

We hope that someone can give us a hint what this could be related to or what else we could try or check so that we can give a reproduction example on stackblitz.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.1.3
- CDK/Material: 8.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox and possibly all others
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Win 10 64-bit
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "overlays not working in CDK 8.1.2" (#16651)

Issues.Title: Detect if DialogRef close has been called
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Provide a method/property on DialogRef to indicate the dialog is in a closing state (i.e. dialogRef.close() has been called).  For example: dialogRef.isClosing() or dialogRef.state

#### Use Case

There is a small but non-negligible span of time between calling dialogRef.close() and the dialog actually being removed.  It would be nice to be able to prevent certain user actions during this time, in a generic fashion.  Currently, you either have to take another action every time you call close() (which doesn't account for calls coming from within the component, could be missed/isn't generic) or check the _state property of MatDialogContainer (which is an internal property of an internal class, so not something anyone should do).  Having this state indicator would allow a single common component used on many dialogs to handle such a behavior.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Detect if DialogRef close has been called" (#16636)

Issues.Title: Autosized textarea is unable to Undo on Firefox
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/cdk-textarea-autosize-issue-demo

Steps to reproduce:
1. Use Firefox to type, paste, delete into any textarea with `matTextareaAutosize`
2. Try Undo in the browser
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

The undo feature in the browser should work as expected.


#### Actual Behavior

There's no undo option enabled on Firefox.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.1.3
- CDK/Material: 8.1.1
- Browser(s): Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): 
macOS / Debian (Maybe on Windows too)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autosized textarea is unable to Undo on Firefox" (#16629)

Issues.Title: Navigation schematic the sidenav is always hidden
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction
```
ng generate @angular/material:nav <component-name>

```
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

When the component load first time in a device that doesn't match Handset the sidenav should be opened .

#### Actual Behavior

The sidenav stays closed until we resize the page to match HandSet, only after that the sidenav returns to the expected behavior. 

#### Troubleshooting
component.html
```
// this should return true or false but it is returning null 
(isHandset$ | async) 

```
component.ts

```
   isHandset$: Observable<boolean> = this.breakpointObserver.observe(Breakpoints.Handset)
    .pipe(
      map(result => result.matches),
     // we should replace share() with shareReplay(1) to let the new subscribers get the old value.
      share()
    );

```
#### Environment
    "@angular/animations": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/cdk": "~8.1.1",
    "@angular/common": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/compiler": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/core": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/flex-layout": "^8.0.0-beta.26",
    "@angular/forms": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/material": "^8.1.1",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "~8.1.2",
    "@angular/router": "~8.1.2",
    "angular-webstorage-service": "^1.0.2",
    "hammerjs": "^2.0.8",
    "rxjs": "~6.4.0",
    "tslib": "^1.9.0",
    "zone.js": "~0.9.1"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navigation schematic the sidenav is always hidden" (#16628)
